src/com/placesandplaces/RouteSegmentOverlay.java

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 package com.placesandplaces;
00002 
00003 import android.graphics.Canvas;
00004 import android.graphics.Paint;
00005 import android.graphics.Point;
00006 
00007 import com.google.android.maps.GeoPoint;
00008 import com.google.android.maps.MapView;
00009 import com.google.android.maps.Overlay;
00010 
00011 public class RouteSegmentOverlay extends Overlay {
00012         private GeoPoint locpoint;
00013         private Paint paint;
00014         private GeoPoint routePoints [];
00015         private int routeGrade[];
00016         private boolean routeIsActive;  
00017         private Point pold, pnew, pp;
00018         private int numberRoutePoints;
00019         
00020         // Constructor permitting the route array to be passed as an argument.
00021         public RouteSegmentOverlay(GeoPoint[] routePoints, int[] routeGrade) {
00022                 this.routePoints = routePoints;
00023                 this.routeGrade = routeGrade;
00024                 numberRoutePoints  = routePoints.length;
00025                 routeIsActive = true;
00026                 // If first time, set initial location to start of route
00027                 locpoint = routePoints[0];
00028                 pold = new Point(0, 0);
00029                 pnew = new Point(0,0);
00030                 pp = new Point(0,0);
00031                 paint = new Paint();
00032         }
00033         
00034         // Method to turn route display on and off
00035         public void setRouteView(boolean routeIsActive){
00036                 this.routeIsActive = routeIsActive;
00037         }
00038 
00039         @Override
00040         public void draw(Canvas canvas, MapView mapview, boolean shadow) {
00041                 super.draw(canvas, mapview, shadow);
00042                 if(! routeIsActive) return;
00043                 
00044                 /* 
00045                 The object mapview is a MapView.  The class MapView, documented at 
00046                 http://code.google.com/android/add-ons/google-apis/reference/com/google/android/maps/MapView.html,
00047                 has a method getProjection() that returns a Projection of the MapView.  Projection is an interface, docs at
00048                 http://code.google.com/android/add-ons/google-apis/reference/com/google/android/maps/Projection.html,
00049                 which has a method toPixels(GeoPoint in, android.graphics.Point out), which takes a GeoPoint (in) and outputs
00050                 a Point (out) that contains the screen x and y coordinates (in pixels) corresponding to the GeoPoint. (with latitude
00051                 and longitude specified in microdegrees).  Thus, after implementing mapview.getProjection().toPixels(gp, pp),
00052                 where gp is a GeoPoint, pp.x and pp.y hold the corresponding screen coordinates for the current MapView.
00053                 Note that this translation must be done each time draw is called, since the relationship between GeoPoints and
00054                 x-y coordinates may have changed (for example, if the map were panned or zoomed since the last draw).
00055                  */
00056                 
00057                 mapview.getProjection().toPixels(locpoint, pp);       // Converts GeoPoint to screen pixels
00058                 
00059                 int xoff = 0;
00060                 int yoff = 0;
00061                 int oldx = pp.x;
00062                 int oldy = pp.y;
00063                 int newx = oldx + xoff;
00064                 int newy = oldy + yoff;
00065                 
00066                 paint.setAntiAlias(true);
00067 
00068                 // Draw route segment by segment, setting color and width of segment according to the slope
00069                 // information returned from the server for the route.
00070                 
00071                 for(int i=0; i<numberRoutePoints-1; i++){
00072                         switch(routeGrade[i]){
00073                                 case 1:
00074                                         paint.setARGB(100,255,0,0);
00075                                         paint.setStrokeWidth(3);
00076                                         break;
00077                                 case 2:
00078                                         paint.setARGB(100, 0, 255, 0);
00079                                         paint.setStrokeWidth(5);
00080                                         break;
00081                                 case 3:
00082                                         paint.setARGB(100, 0, 0, 255);
00083                                         paint.setStrokeWidth(7);
00084                                         break;
00085                                 case 4:
00086                                         paint.setARGB(90, 153, 102, 153);
00087                                         paint.setStrokeWidth(6);
00088                                         break;
00089                         }
00090                         
00091                         // Find endpoints of this segment in pixels
00092                         mapview.getProjection().toPixels(routePoints[i], pold);
00093                         oldx = pold.x;
00094                         oldy = pold.y;
00095                         mapview.getProjection().toPixels(routePoints[i+1], pnew);
00096                         newx = pnew.x;
00097                         newy = pnew.y;
00098                         
00099                         // Draw the segment
00100                         canvas.drawLine(oldx, oldy, newx, newy, paint);
00101                 }
00102               
00103         }
00104 
00105 }
